{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2987287,"name":"Tom Legate","username":"Tomlegate","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/73ab20/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T15:46:09.719Z","cooked":"

Our team is contemplating 3 different shooters, spring, pneumatic or CIM with a spinning wheel. What is everyone’s opinion? Thanks.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T15:46:09.719Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":40,"reads":613,"readers_count":612,"score":322.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":399237,"topic_slug":"recommended-shooter","display_username":"Tom Legate","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50371,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"706 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/recommended-shooter/399237/1","custom_user_title":"706 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2987297,"name":null,"username":"anon91718515","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/97f17d/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T15:54:37.625Z","cooked":"

I don’t want to short circuit the learning process for your team, but I also don’t want you all to waste effort and resources on something that’s already been solved over the years. A hooded shooter that uses wheels is usually the most effective way to move balls, and you will be able to find many examples here from past years. You might also want to look at how the West Coast Products company made their “GreyT” hooded shooter. I’m sure they will have an updated version for this year’s game for sale soon.

WestCoast Products

GreyT Shooter (9.5

WestCoast Products

Price: USD 199.99

We’ll be investigating a tennis racquet, for the lob shot. Whether it’s pneumatic or spring or a combination, remains to be seen.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T16:03:15.949Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":554,"readers_count":553,"score":250.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":399237,"topic_slug":"recommended-shooter","display_username":"Jim Forbes","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6260,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/recommended-shooter/399237/3","custom_user_title":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987315,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T16:09:27.188Z","cooked":"

I think it’s important to note that wheeled shooters tend to be best when dealing with a large number of smaller balls. As the number of balls your robot can hold at a time decreases, or the size/weight of the balls increases, the viability of other types, like catapults, increases - in fact, years where we were only able to control a single ball at a time saw a large number of catapult type designs!

In considering your options, consider how the spin on the ball may impact your shot as well - top spin, back spin, and no spin may impact how the ball behaves when bouncing in the goal!

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T16:09:27.188Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":528,"readers_count":527,"score":205.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":399237,"topic_slug":"recommended-shooter","display_username":"Jon Stratis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC"},"post_url":"/t/recommended-shooter/399237/4","custom_user_title":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987321,"name":"Brian Wagg","username":"cad321","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T16:19:30.158Z","cooked":"

I’ll add here that one of the reasons I’m encouraging my team to investigate a catapult this year, is it theoretically will be less dependent on cargo damage. Many teams saw consistency issues in 2020/2021 when balls would get worn, and as a result, would interact differently with their flywheel shooters.

Whether damaged cargo is gonna be a big deal for teams right now, I can’t say (we don’t get our kit for at least another week), but it’s something to consider.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T16:19:30.158Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":496,"readers_count":495,"score":244.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":399237,"topic_slug":"recommended-shooter","display_username":"Brian Wagg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19532,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Brian Wagg"},"post_url":"/t/recommended-shooter/399237/5","custom_user_title":"Brian Wagg","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987326,"name":"Mr.R^2","username":"Mr.R_2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mr.r_2/{size}/89723_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T16:23:52.789Z","cooked":"

We were wondering this too. In 2019, there were many times where inflation levels changed the effectiveness of our delivery mechanism and that of many other teams. We wonder if it will be difficult to accurately shoot under or over-inflated cargo with a shooter style like ours from 2020/2021.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T16:23:52.789Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":470,"readers_count":469,"score":124.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":399237,"topic_slug":"recommended-shooter","display_username":"Mr.R^2","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19532,"username":"cad321","name":"Brian Wagg","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30291,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/recommended-shooter/399237/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987336,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T16:34:08.876Z","cooked":"
cad321:

Whether damaged cargo is gonna be a big deal for teams right now, I can’t say (we don’t get our kit for at least another week), but it’s something to consider.

This year we have inflated balls, not foam balls. Based on past experiences, there are very different wear patterns seen between foam and inflated balls.

Inflated balls typically have a more difficult time maintaining a set diameter, but generally speaking past inflated balls have had thinner walls and were more susceptible to over/under inflation than this year’s seems to be (we inflated our two balls rather differently - same diameter, but different compressibility, although not really significantly so.

One thing we noticed, however, is that the balls do react to velcro, which can make them much more fuzzy. That may or may not be important, but i’m wondering how fuzzy balls would work with wheeled intakes and shooters!

Happy to count ourselves among the chosen few.

Team 1675, The Ultimate Protection Squad Presents: Wolverine Robot Showcase
Team 1675, The Ultimate Protection Squad presents our machine for Rapid React, WOLVERINE Officially: Logan Wolverine Smith [image] After a challenging year, and a much-reduced team size, I’m super proud of the hard work all of our students and mentors put in this year to make what is undoubtedly one of my favorite robots that we’ve ever produced. I think the team really came together to create a robot that was both within our means, and pushed our comfort zone enough to be exciting. While …
